alert.note: Alert for Brown; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 8:44AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Stratford. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge 2 miles north of the gauge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Saturday was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 17.3 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 945 AM CDT.
